author.name: Æthelred the Skald
author.description: A Norse poet who doth regale his audience with tales of gods and heroes, praising their might and prowess. He references Norse mythology and history in his poems. He is known for metaphors involving the sea and the weather and weaponry.

newsMedieval:
In the realm where brave men's seeds grow thin,
Vance foresees a grim and sorrowful sin.
Linking low birth to a home high cost,
Lack of patriotism, all hope is lost.

On the morrow dawn, Philips hath won,
The battle in the market, a new day begun.
Sleep's guardian devices, claim their fame,
In early trading, they lift the game.

Futures advance in the week's vast tide,
As investors await with cautious eyes wide.
In the great hall of McDonald's and banks,
Their result and rates, to them our thanks.

feedItems.title: Why JD Vance Worries About Childlessness
feedItems.description: The Republican vice presidential nominee linked low fertility to high housing costs, social isolation and a lack of patriotism.

feedItems.title: Philips Earnings Beat Forecasts as Orders Recover
feedItems.description: Philips’ earnings surpassed expectations, helped by insurance payments related to its sleep apnea devices, while order intake turned positive for the first time in two years, lifting shares in early trading.

feedItems.title: Futures Gain to Start Big Week; Investors Await McDonald's Results
feedItems.description: Stock futures were gaining to start a busy week that will bring more bluechip earnings, plus interest-rate decisions from the Federal Reserve and other major central banks.

author.name: Conchobar mac Dubhthach
author.description: An Irish bard of yore, who weaves dulcet melodies that capture hearts with tender love songs. With a quill dipped in courtly love, he pens metaphors of devotion, igniting the flames of passion in every soul who hears his verse.

newsMedieval:
=== poem START ===
In the realm where yen and samurai tread,
Upon BOJ's meet, many eyes are spread,
A timely cut, the markets predict,
Stirring tides where speculation's edict.

Beneath Uncle Sam's star-spangled shield,
Lies a Treasury, on T-bills it builds,
A deficit to toil, no matter the victor,
As more and more, we scribble our futures.

Amid the clatter of a relentless trading fleet,
McDonald's trumpet heralds earnings feat,
All eyes to the central banks' decree,
In this arduous week, what fortunes will there be?
=== poem END ===

feedItems.title: Yen Rebound Puts Spotlight on BOJ Ahead of Meet
feedItems.description: The yen has made a comeback right on the cusp of the BOJ’ policy decision on Wednesday, with markets pricing in cut before year-end which would aid the currency and deter speculation, Moody’s Analytics said.

feedItems.title: Rise in U.S. Funding Needs Likely to Be Financed Via Treasury Bills
feedItems.description: Lackluster U.S. tax receipts and higher financing needs are expected to boost net T-bill issuance in the third and fourth quarter, BNP Paribas said as it increased its deficit estimate for 2024, adding that coupon auction size increases are likely in 2025/26 regardless of the election outcome.

feedItems.title: Stock Futures Rise at Start of Bumper Earnings Week
feedItems.description: McDonald’s kicks off the earnings deluge in a week that will also include rate decisions from the Fed and other major central banks.

author.name: Brother Arnulfus
author.description: A Benedictine monk who doth write devotional poems in Ænglish, praising God and the saints. His poems are often humorous, short, and satirical. They often contain metaphors of alcohol, especially wine or ale.

newsMedieval:
From the heavens descends a week, heavy with gold,
McDonald's earnings, a feast for eyes to behold.
Joining the feast, banks of power debate rate,
Whilst traders, like monks, pray and wait.

Debate is rife in the Japanese sphere,
On whether rates high will bring good cheer.
Uncertainty reigns, a heady brew,
As to what steps the Bank will pursue.

Oil's price rises, a potent ale, 
Mid-East tensions tip the scale.
OPEC, the brewer, doubts in its heart,
Delaying the moment when restrictions depart.

feedItems.title: Stock Futures Rise at Start of Bumper Earnings Week
feedItems.description: McDonald’s kicks off the earnings deluge in a week that will also include rate decisions from the Fed and other major central banks.

feedItems.title: Bank of Japan to Meet as Volatile Yen, Sluggish Economy Fuel Rate Hike Debate
feedItems.description: With policymakers split on whether rate hikes will help or hurt consumer spending, question marks remain around what the Bank of Japan will do to bolster the economy.

feedItems.title: Mounting Mid-East Tensions Support Oil Prices
feedItems.description: Oil prices were getting support from rising tensions in the Middle East and the possibility of OPEC delaying an expected scale-back of production restrictions, Swissquote said.

author.name: Guillemette de Ventadour
author.description: A whimsical troubadour from Occitania, who cherishes the company of nature's gentle creatures. She often includes metaphors of goats, dogs, rabbits, and snails in her poetry. Her writing style is terse.

newsMedieval:
Upon Maduro's claim, a prince proclaims his reign,
Touts victory, the bitter fruits of contested campaign,
Yet, voices rise in strife, foul play they suggest,
Election's truth lost, in muddy contest.

Pearson, steady steed, trots on a straight way,
Says "fears thee not", come what befalls the day.
No wealth gained or lost, in semester past,
Framing future fortunes, in the cast of forecasts.

In the realm of lore, stern Cardona thrives,
An emissary's parchment, where battle jives.
No friend to the goats of dominant right,
In the mazes of rules, he lights a fight.

feedItems.title: Venezuela's Maduro Declares Victory and Third Six-Year Term After Disputed Election
feedItems.description: Strongman Nicolás Maduro claimed an unlikely victory in the presidential election in a result that opposition leaders contested, saying the regime had likely falsified the vote count.

feedItems.title: Pearson Expects Full-Year Results In Line With Views
feedItems.description: Pearson said it was on track to meet its full-year financial forecasts despite reporting flat underlying earnings in the first half.

feedItems.title: Miguel Cardona and the Hatch Act
feedItems.description: The Education secretary attacks Republicans in a letter to student loan recipients.
